Here are three movie recommendations that fit your criteria:

  1. "Maleficent" (2014) - This animated fairy tale follows the story of Maleficent, who has been cursed by a jealous fairy for killing her child. In this film, Maleficent learns about love and forgiveness, and ultimately helps to restore peace to her troubled land.
  2. "Due Date" (2010) - This road comedy follows the story of Lance Summer, a high-strung father-to-be who is forced to hitch a ride with aspiring actor Ethan Tremblay on a road trip in order to make it to his child's birth on time.
  3. "Downfall" (2004) - This historical drama follows the story of Reinhold von Tück, a high-ranking German army officer who was forced to give a deposition in which he admitted that he had been involved in a plot to assassinate Adolf Hitler himself.

I would recommend "Total Recall" for someone who enjoys action-packed movies with a sci-fi twist.

The plot of "Total Recall" revolves around a man named Douglas Quaid (played by Arnold Schwarzenegger) who believes that he is actually a spy living in the United States. 

Quaid discovers that he has been implanted with memories from his life as a spy, which he has never experienced before.

Desperate to uncover the truth about himself, Quaid goes on a mission to retrieve his actual memories.

In this thrilling adventure movie, Arnold Schwarzenegger delivers an incredible performance as Douglas Quaid, a man who believes that he is actually a spy living in the United States.

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text: I would highly recommend "Mama" (2013). The film follows the journey of Kim Addison, a woman who survived domestic violence and set out to empower women and children against bullying and abuse. One of her students is Logan Chauvin, a thirteen-year-old boy from Finland who was terrorized daily in school by callous bullies. Logan has been training vigorously with Kim to overcome his experience and is now getting ready for his first real MMA fight. Although Kim has done everything in her power to train Logan to stand up to bullies at school, there is very little she can do to protect him from his first real MMA opponent. The film "Mama" (2013) directed by László Nemes and produced by György Szabo, Tania Ferrante and László Nemes, stars the talented Megan Charpentier as Kim Addison, Isabelle Nélisse as Fran, Javier Botet as Miriam, Logan Chauvin as Logan. The film is a powerful and emotional drama that explores themes of domestic violence, trauma, healing, empowerment, and resilience. I highly recommend "Mama" (2013) directed by László Nemes and produced by György Szabo, Tania Ferrante and László Nemes, stars the talented Megan Charpentier as Kim Addison, Isabelle Nélisse as Fran, Javier Botet as Miriam, Logan Chauvin as Logan.
